medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of angio-oedema and severe abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced recurrent episodes of abdominal pain of unknown origin during her pregnancy. A previous pregnancy had ended in miscarriage. She initiated oral contraceptive treatment at age 17 and had been hospitalized due to ascites. Recently, she consulted due to a recent episode of facial angio-oedema after starting estrogen patches 2 months prior. An abdominal sonogram showed ascites and intestinal swelling. Her condition improved spontaneously after discontinuing the contraceptives.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous miscarriage; episodes of angio-oedema associated with oral contraceptives.
medical_history.family_history: Mother developed recurrent angio-oedema attacks, with normal C4 and C1INH levels.
